keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The case of seven men who went to Syria and returned home reflects a quandary for France and the rest of the Continent after the attacks in Paris and Brussels.

headline.print_headline: Europe Struggles to Manage  Those Who Return From ISIS
headline.main: He Disavowed Radical Islam. Was He Lying?

snippet: The case of seven men who went to Syria and returned home reflects a quandary for France and the rest of the Continent after the attacks in Paris and Brussels.
abstract: Europe faces growing challenge in determining best response to young Muslim men who have returned home after receiving training from Islamic State overseas, but who have neither committed acts of terrorism nor been implicated in a plot; at least 14 European countries have made receiving terrorism training criminal offense, but monitoring high numbers of returning recruits and building case against them is difficult and raises civil liberties issues.
